com.alfred.common.datamodel

Class StateDeviceManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.alfred.common.datamodel.StateDeviceManager

  • public class StateDeviceManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the backbone of the Alfred API. It manages the list of devices managed by the API client application (like the Alfred Server project for Raspberry Pi or the Alfred Client project for Android) This class also manages the list of Device Handlers registered with the API.

    The core functionality is simple: a device is created and added to this StateDeviceManager class using the addStateDevice method. The device can then be accessed at any point in the future by called getDevice and supplying the device id.

    Handlers are treated identically to devices - they can be added with the addDeviceHandler method. When a state device is added, removed, or updated the registered handlers are notified with a reference to the device.

    Author:
    Kevin Kanzelmeyer

    • Method Detail

      • getDevice

        public static StateDevice getDevice(java.lang.String id)
        Method to retrieve a clone of a device. Returns null if the device doesn't exist
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the desired device
        Returns:
        an instance of the desired state device. Note that this method returns "null" if the desired object doesn't exist

      • contains

        public static boolean contains(java.lang.String id)
        Method to see if the device manager contains a specified device
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the desired device
        Returns:
        True if the device exists in the Device Manager, False otherwise

      • getAllDevices

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,StateDevice> getAllDevices()
        Method to retrieve all devices
        Returns:
        A Hashmap of all registered devices in the Device Manager

      • addStateDevice

        public static void addStateDevice(StateDevice device)
        This method adds the input device to be managed by the Device Manager. It will notify all registered StateDeviceHandlers that a new device has been added
        Parameters:
        device - A StateDevice

      • removeStateDevice

        public static void removeStateDevice(StateDevice device)
        This method removes a device from the device manager
        Parameters:
        device - A StateDevice

      • updateStateDevice

        public static void updateStateDevice(StateDevice device)
        Method to update a given state device. Note that if the device doesn't currently exist it will be added. Also note that the state device will only be updated if the input device state is different
        Parameters:
        device - an instance of the device to update

      • updateStateDevice

        public static void updateStateDevice(java.lang.String id,
                                     StateDeviceProtos.StateDeviceMessage.State state)
        Method to update a given state device. Note that if the device doesn't currently exist it will be added. Also note that the state device will only be updated if the input device state is different
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the device to update
        state - The new state

        Parameters:
